description: Fresh winged beans contain quite a good amount of vitamin-C.Vitamin-C is a powerful water-soluble antioxidant, and when adequately provided in the diet, it helps build immunity against infections, maintain blood vessel elasticity, and offer some protection against cancers.
Winged beans provide adequate amounts of minerals, and vitamins. Some of the essential minerals such as iron, copper, manganese, calcium, phosphorus, magnesium are concentrated in them.
Manganese is utilized in the human body as a co-factor for the powerful antioxidant enzyme, superoxide dismutase.
name: Winged Bean
pros: Fresh winged beans contain quite a good amount of vitamin-C.Vitamin-C is a powerful water-soluble antioxidant, and when adequately provided in the diet, it helps build immunity against infections, maintain blood vessel elasticity, and offer some protection against cancers.
Winged beans provide adequate amounts of minerals, and vitamins. Some of the essential minerals such as iron, copper, manganese, calcium, phosphorus, magnesium are concentrated in them.
Manganese is utilized in the human body as a co-factor for the powerful antioxidant enzyme, superoxide dismutase.
Vitamin E is also found in the unsaturated oil derived from these beans.
Adequate folate content in the diet around conception and during pregnancy can help prevent neural-tube defects in the newborn baby.
Winged beans are rich in calcium and phosphorus.
